BI Gelar FESyar 2019, Dorong Pengembangan Ekonomi Syariah
07 Nov 2019, 00:36 by Saviera Amalia


BI Gelar FESyar 2019, Dorong Pengembangan Ekonomi Syariah

KBRN, Surabaya : Indonesia sebagai negara berpenduduk muslim terbesar di dunia memiliki potensi menjadi pusat ekonomi syariah terkemuka. Hal tersebut dapat diimplementasikan dengan pengembangan 6 sektor unggulan industri halal di tanah air, misalnya seperti industri makanan halal, pariwisata halal, fesyen muslim, industri kreatif, pertanian terintegrasi, serta energi terbarukan.Untuk itulah, dengan mengembangkan segala potensi yang ada, Bank Indonesia (BI) menggelar kegiatan Festival Ekonomi Syariah (FESyar) 2019 yang bertujuan mendukung Indonesia untuk menjadi pusat pengembangan ekonomi syariah di dunia.Â "Kita cukup optimis, bahwa kedepan Indonesia dapat memainkan peran yang lebih besar sebagai industri halal yang tidak hanya sanggup mencukupi kebutuhan di dalam negeri, namun juga bisa memenuhi pasar global," ujar Deputi Gubernur Bank Indonesia, Dody Budi Waluyo dalam sambutan pembukaan kegiatan FESyar 2019 di Grand City Convention & Exhibition, Surabaya, Rabu (6/11/19) malam.Mengusung tema "Sinergi Membangun Ekonomi Syariah Indonesia", FESyar 2019 menyadari akan pentingnya komitmen kuat dalam mewujudkan sinergi antar pemangku kepentingan di Indonesia untuk lebih meningkatkan peranan ekonomi dan keuangan syariah bagi perekonomian nasional.Sebanyak 144 booth menjajakan produk syariah serta tersedia panggung untuk dilaksanakannya seminar ekonomi syariah dalam giat FESyar 2019 yang dulai sejak 6-9 November 2019.Surabaya merupakan lokasi ketiga diselenggarakannya FESyar 2019 setelah sebelumnya telah diadakan di Palembang pada Agustus mewakili regional Sumatera dan di Banjarmasin pada September mewakili kepesertaan dari regional Kawasan Timur Indonesia.Menurut Dody, FESyar terbukti mampu mendorong sektor keuangan syariah pada masing-masing daerah dengan dibuktikan banyaknya pengunjung untuk putaran pertama di Palembang yakni sekitar 11 ribu orang dengan transaksi business matching mencapai Rp 2,11 Triliun atau meningkat dari 2018 dengan nilai transaksi Rp 210 Miliar.Sedangkan putaran kedua di Banjarmasin, tingkat kunjungan mencapai 41 ribu orang disertai komitmen business matching senilai Rp2,61 triliun atau meningkat cukup tinggi melebihi capaian tahun sebelumnya yaitu Rp1,7 triliun.Sementara pagelaran festival di Surabaya pada tahun 2018 mampu menghasilkan transaksi business matching sekitar Rp7,1 triliun dan diharapkan dapat terus meningkat pada pagelaran 2019.Festival Ekonomi Syariah (FESyar) merupakan perhelatan tahunan yang berlangsung sejak 2017 dan berlangsung di berbagai wilayah di Indonesia yang mencakup 2 kegiatan utama, yakni Sharia Economic Forum dan Sharia Fair.Tak hanya itu, melalui festival tersebut juga akan ada perumusan rekomendasi kebijakan untuk mendukung implementasi strategi pengembangan ekonomi syariah nasional yang tercermin dari tiga pilar yakni pemberdayaan ekonomi, pendalaman pasar keuangan syariah, dan riset serta edukasi.Hal ini diharapkan berjalan baik melalui sinergi dengan Komite Nasional Keuangan Syariah (KNKS) untuk mewujudkan visi Indonesia sebagai pusat ekonomi dan keuangan syariah dunia di masa yang akan datang."Semoga, sinergi yang baik antar lembaga dengan didukung implementasi program yang inovatif dan semakin berorientasi pada kualitas," tutup Dody.

BI Holds FESyar 2019, Encourage Sharia Economic Development
Nov 7 2019, 00:36 by Saviera Amalia


BI Holds FESyar 2019, Encourage Sharia Economic Development

KBRN, Surabaya: Indonesia as the largest Muslim population in the world has the potential to become a leading Islamic economic center. This can be implemented by developing 6 leading sectors of the halal industry in the country, for example, the halal food industry, halal tourism, Muslim fashion, creative industries, integrated agriculture, and renewable energy. For this reason, by developing all the potential that exists, Bank Indonesia ( BI) held the 2019 Sharia Economic Festival (FESyar) activity aimed at supporting Indonesia to become the center of sharia economic development in the world. "We are quite optimistic, that in the future Indonesia can play a greater role as a halal industry that is not only able to meet domestic needs, but can also meet the global market," said Deputy Governor of Bank Indonesia, Dody Budi Waluyo in his opening remarks at 2019 FESyar activities at the Grand City Convention & Exhibition, Surabaya, Wednesday (6/11/19) evening. Carrying the theme "Synergy in Building the Sharia Economy of Indonesia", FESyar 2019 realizes the importance of a strong commitment in realizing synergy between stakeholders in Indonesia to further enhance the role of the economy and Islamic finance for the national economy. As many as 144 booths sell sharia products and there is a stage for sharia economic seminars to be held in the 2019 FESyar program which began on November 6-9, 2019. Surabaya is the third location of FESyar 2019 after it was held in Palembang on August representing the region Sumatra and Banjarmasin on Septe mber represented the membership of the Eastern Indonesia Region. According to Dody, FESyar was proven to be able to encourage the sharia financial sector in each region by proving the number of visitors for the first round in Palembang which was around 11 thousand people with business matching transactions reaching Rp 2.11 trillion or increasing from 2018 with a transaction value of Rp 210 billion. While the second round in Banjarmasin, the level of visits reached 41 thousand people accompanied by a business matching commitment worth Rp2.61 trillion, or increased quite high compared to the achievements of the previous year which was Rp1.7 trillion. While the festival performance in Surabaya on in 2018 it is able to produce business matching transactions of around Rp. 7 trillion and is expected to continue to increase in the 2019 performance. The Sharia Economic Festival (FESyar) is an annual event that takes place since 2017 and takes place in various regions in Indonesia covering 2 main activities, namely Sharia Economic Forum and Sharia Fair. Not only that, through the festival there will also be the formulation of policy recommendations to support the implementation of a national sharia economic development strategy reflected in three pillars namely economic empowerment, deepening of the Islamic financial market, and research and education. This is expected to work well through synergy with National Sharia Finance Committee (KNKS) to realize the vision of Indonesia as the world economic and sharia financial center in the future. "Hopefully, good synergy between institutions supported by the implementation of innovative programs and increasingly oriented towards quality," concluded Dody.
